title: Kenya: Safaricom Updates Next of Kin On How to Claim Unused M-Pesa Funds
text:
Kenya: Street Families to Be Moved From Nairobi CBD Ahead of Obama Visit 
The Next of Kin will be required to present various documents to Safaricom in order to claim a deceased customer's unused M-PESA funds:- 
For M-pesa accounts having more than Kshs. 30,000, the documents required are: a copy of the Death Certificate, a copy of the ID of Next of Kin, Grant of probate (where an M-Pesa subscriber dies and has written a will) and Letters of Administration (where a person dies without a will). 
For M-pesa accounts having less than Kshs. 30,000, one needs the following to claim the M-Pesa funds: affidavit administered by a Commissioner for Oaths and sworn by the claimant, Death Certificate (not burial permit), letter from Provincial Administration of the deceased's area of residence or letters of administration and Next of Kin's ID and copy to be retained. 
However in cases of dispute, the next of kin will be required to provide Letters of administrations or grant of probate. 
Earlier this year, it was reported in local dailies that Kshs 500 million from idle M-Pesa accounts whose owners could not be traced were to be submitted to the Unclaimed Financial Assets Authority (UFAA). 
This move by Safaricom was in accordance with the unclaimed financial assets law, which requires financial institutions, companies and utility companies to give up any assets that have lain idle for a period of time. 
Safaricom pointed out that for funds to be considered dormant it would take a long period of inactivity by an M-pesa user, and even after funds are handed to the UFAA. There is still a way for someone to get the money back. 
"The funds submitted to the UFAA are those that have been dormant for a period of two years either due to inactivity on the M-PESA Account or where a customer is deceased and the funds have not been claimed by the next of kin." The post added. 
"Where funds have been submitted to the UFAA the next of kin can still claim them from the UFAA by filing a claim with them. The next of kin will be required to provide certain documentation as will be advised by the UFAA." It continued. 
One can register their next of kin details, free of charge, from your phone by dialing *234# and Selecting Next of Kin. Kenya
